definitions: Diminishes or destroys the value or quality of.
Harms the character of (someone, especially a child) by being too lenient or indulgent.
Treats with great generosity and indulgence.
Becomes bad or unfit for use, especially food.
examples: The rain spoils our picnic plans.
Too much praise spoils a child.
He spoils his grandchildren with gifts.
The milk spoils quickly in the heat.
